tool.help:
**Description**
Mapsembler2 is a targeted assembly software. It takes as input a set of NGS raw reads (fasta or fastq, gzipped or not) and a set of input sequences (starters). It first determines if each starter is read-coherent, e.g. whether reads confirm the presence of each starter in the original sequence. Then for each read-coherent starter, Mapsembler2 outputs its sequence neighborhood as a linear sequence or as a graph, depending on the user choice. Mapsembler2 may be used for (not limited to):
· Validate an assembled sequence (input as starter), e.g. from a de Bruijn graph assembly where read-coherence was not enforced.
· Checks if a gene (input as starter) has an homolog in a set of reads.
· Checks if a known enzyme is present in a metagenomic NGS read set.
· Enrich unmappable reads by extending them, possibly making them mappable.
· Checks what happens at the extremities of a contig.
· Remove contaminants or symbiont reads from a read set
-------

http://colibread.inria.fr/mapsembler2/
